alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 05 at 10:39AM EST until February 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.5 feet Thursday morning. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued by Saturday evening.
